Lack of official national tracking: The expert mentions that there is no official national tracking of the number of people in jail due to being unable to afford bail. This lack of comprehensive data makes it difficult to verify the claim accurately.
Extrapolation from Bureau of Justice Sta: Researchers have used data from the U.S. Bureau of Justice Statistics to estimate the number of individuals in jail because they cannot afford bail. The bureau's 2018 report, based on 2016 data, states that there were 458,600 "unconvicted" people held in jails across the country. However, it is important to note that not all of these individuals were held solely due to their inability to pay bail.

Hamilton Project report: Bernie Sanders' campaign refers to a December 2018 report by the Hamilton Project, which is part of the Brookings Institution.
